title: I got banned for being non toxic.
body:
http://prntscr.com/9a38qp
http://prntscr.com/9a38tf

That entire game i was being harassed by teammates and enemies. I told them i would mute them and report them. I said a few things about sona or kat, but they werent overly toxic. No way i should be banned for this. Riot better reconsider.

replies.body:
The email sent to you contains the chat from the game that triggered the investigation and punishment of your account. If you attempt to login, you will be presented with chat from more games (3 in total).

Also, remember that the severity of punishment is affected by previous punishments as outlined here:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Boqd81O0-upcoming-upgrades-to-chat-restrictions

Threatening to report people is something that the community has determined is toxic behavior, and there is a lot of that in this single game listed. You threaten 3 people with reports. The best thing to do is simply mute people and continue playing.

I hope that helps clarify the situation.

Honestly, stating that someone is getting reported for their disrespectful behaviour is not threatening. It's just stating. If I want the person to know who got them banned, if I consider that I don't need the anonimity of the report function, why not?
Yeah. It's like getting arrested for telling a thief you're calling the cops on him for breaking into a car.

It's considered negative because it will never help resolve the situation at hand, and will often make it worse. This is the opposite of what the player behavior team is trying to have happen in games.

I think that it's important for punished people to knw that it's not some broken system's casualties that got them punished, but rather te fact that they broke the rules of a community and everything turns against them: the communiy, its institutions and its individual members.

> [{quoted}](name=Photos of Ghosts,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=1nb59H62,comment-id=0005000000000000,timestamp=2015-12-05T01:30:12.991+0000)
>
> I think that it's important for punished people to knw that it's not some broken system's casualties that got them punished, but rather te fact that they broke the rules of a community and everything turns against them: the communiy, its institutions and its individual members.

Re-read the red post, and then filter it through the fact that the system is actually designed to learn what people on that server location consider toxic. 

In essence, the system picks out that spamming 'you are reported' is toxic because the community reports it as toxic, not the other way around.
Still if people report it, then it means it affected them negatively. And from that alone it is toxic.
Well when you are the kid who goes "lol get reported idiot. Enjoy your ban retard. You deserve the pushishment ur gonna get" I'd be happy to see that people think that is unacceptable.

No. No.
No "idiot". No "retard". I just say "report me/him as much as you want, you're the wrong one so we don't fear anything."

I'm fine with that. If a person calmly says that they might rep the other person and says it once, *maybe* twice, I'm ok with that. I just don't like the people who use it as a "I'm obviously right and better than you so suck it".
Whoops, wrong conversation xD not exactly the same situation as I thought, but pretty much the same spirit.

But what about saying "reported" stating my commitment to report them. I've had plenty of people report me because this changed their opinion of me. That they then felt I was their enemy when I had only stated my opinion of their behavior.
You cut off half the second image...

Fascinating.  Telling people you're going to report them is considered bad form.  I didn't know that.  But it's interesting because if I tell someone I'm going to report them, I do so.  I don't make empty threats.  Rarely do I have to tell people what I'm going to do though.  When I do, they will know why I did it in the first place.

Yes, quite fascinating.  I'm going to keep that in mind.

It's not about the empty threat. It's about how those threats affect the players in the game. Often, calling for reports is seen as negative by the *neutral* parties in the game (that is, those not involved in the flaming or the report-calling).
No you didnt.

The bolded is where you went wrong. Don't even say **ANYTHING** to them, just ignore what they are saying and report after the game. Simple.

Take this as a learning experience and don't do crap like this again
http://i.memeful.com/memes/RjAQ68M/Maury-Lie-Detector.jpg

well, first of all, there's no way you got banned over one game. you have to be consistently toxic to get a 2 week ban. you were given many warnings

second of all, even if you did nothing else wrong here, you still told people to report them. riot considers that harassment for some reason. one report is just as valuable as your entire team reporting them, so next time this kind of thing happens, don't ask anyone else to report. just mute, report, and move on.

> [{quoted}](name=trying too hard,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=1nb59H62,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-12-04T03:26:29.829+0000)

I get false reported all the time. If I didn't gank enough or for a toxic person in general who loses lane, there's a chance he will lie to enemy team that I'm toxic and get me reported.

Then it takes 1 game on a report card where I said something tame like so so is overpowered, and it's gg for me, banned.

Is it toxic to state things like

I am reporting driven for leaving the game/afking (gone from 7 min not return at end of game)

It's not a threat it's staying a fact, I also I've told others I will report them if they continue certain behaviors (like constantly bad language and harassing allies/ enemies in chat

I would t consider that toxic as its a warning that they are out of line before I chose to report them, if they don't stop I drop the issue and report at the end of the game, if they do stop I don't report them as they made an effort to stop thier behavior (this one is rare but it happens)

I do t think saying you will be reporting someone is toxic if you don't constantly push it, give them a warning that you feel they are being toxic, if they shrug it off drop it and report it at end of Match, if they stop being toxic I don't report

There's a difference between stating a warning and threatening

> [{quoted}](name=alfavhunter,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=1nb59H62,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-12-07T20:26:22.299+0000)

>

I personally don't care if someone says they are reporting something or even asking at the end of the game more as a reminder. The only time I take notice of anything like that is people who are constantly like "reported", "report this, report that".

That said, the system clearly considers all of it negative. If all you ever did wrong was say report X afk one time in a small amount of your games its probably not going to be enough on its own to get you punished but it will be counting against you in w/e small way.

Not particularly relevant, but it drives me nuts when people talk like something being a fact excludes it from being what ever negative thing it also is. Usually its like "its not harassment, its just stating facts", or in this case "its not a threat its a fact". Something being true or a fact does not mean that it is not a threat. If someone said "if you don't give me your money I will shoot you". Assuming they meant it that is both a fact and a threat. You could also consider it a warning.

TLDR: You should never be mentioning reporting anyone in game for any reason.
It's also unnecessary because the system only cares if there are *any* reports from a game, not how many.
Relax accept the punishment. It is not the end of the world.  Just a miss understanding its not a permanent ban.
